alert.note: Alert for Hickman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 10:20AM CST until March 01 at 7:48AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County. For the Duck River...including Centerville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River At Centerville. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, All areas along the Duck River near Centerville will be covered by flood waters. Defeated Creek, Bears Creek, Swan Creek, Lowes Bend, and Horse Branch Creek will be flooded due to backwater. Many roads near the river will be impassable due to high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 30.9 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Friday was 31.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.1 feet on 03/22/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1100 AM CST.
